content: the **catal top** allows you to show off a subtly lowered neckline without being too revealing on a summer day you can wear it with shorts or a skirt or pair it with jeans in mid-season this is a revised version of the original pattern including more sizes and a neater way to decrease it is worked in-the-round completely seamless and from the bottom up until the armholes front and back are then separated and worked flat until the shoulders **about the pattern** **sizes ** 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 **finished circumference around the bust ** 79 88 98 107 117 129 139 148 158 cm/ 31 5 35 25 39 25 42 75 46 75 51 5 55 5 59 25 63 25 **positive ease** approx 2-5 cm / 0 75-2 **how to choose your size ** measure your bust circumference with a tape measure add the desired amount of ease to your actual bust measurement you can use the recommended ease range as a guide find the closest measurement to the finished garment **gauge** 19 stitches x 30 rounds = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 in stockinette stitch worked in the round and flat using the main needles after blocking **suggested needle size ** 4 mm/us 6 main circular needle or size needed to obtain gauge 3 5 mm/us 4 circular needles or two
